events.name: Trial by code
events.description: A coding contest consisting of problem-solving questions, starting with easy and then progressively getting harder. It will be beneficial for practice for future OT's and Interviews and will build skills. We are planning on having a scoreboard based on the number of questions/test cases passed.

events.name: Escape room: algorithmic approach
events.description: Similar to a normal escape room except every level consists of an algorithm. Example: data structure: graphs, level 1 (Kahn's algo), level 2 (Dijkstra), level 3 (Kruskal's/Prim's).

events.name: Tech Wordle
events.description: The event is a CS-themed word puzzle game where participants must guess technical terms related to computer science, such as algorithms, programming languages, or data structures.

events.name: Data Science
events.description: Solve business problems using data science. Use ML, AI concepts to solve the problem statement. Level-wise problem statements will be given.

events.name: Mouse less Contest
events.description: You will be given tasks and you have to do it without using a mouse. This can be done in a booth where there will be volunteers who will check whether the mouse is being used or not.

events.name: Build-A-PC Challenge
events.description: An engaging team event where students will have the opportunity to assemble their own fully functional PCs. Teams will race against the clock to assemble their PCs.

events.name: Debugger’s Duel
events.description: A group-based challenge where participants troubleshoot and fix intentional faults in pre-designed circuits. External resources are prohibited.

events.name: LLD: Game on!
events.description: A coding challenge where participants are given incomplete classes and objects and must implement the correct methods to develop a game.

events.name: Voltage Vortex
events.description: Series of rounds where questions and tasks related to electrical engineering are given.

events.name: Dare to feel the pain
events.description: This event brings you the chance of experiencing the pain of period cramps through a simulator.

events.name: Simulation and Modelling workshop
events.description: Participants will explore real-world scenarios, using MATLAB/Simulink software to model circuits, power systems, and control systems.

events.name: Mechanical Kit Assembly
events.description: A mechanical kit will be provided for the team to assemble using different assembly drawings and component lists.

events.name: Primavera Workshop
events.description: Primavera is a construction management software. A workshop in the software training with a case study will be given to the participants.

events.name: Concrete Canoe Contest
events.description: Concrete canoe contest is concrete boat making which has to float in water.

events.name: Forensic Investigation
events.description: A workshop on DNA fingerprinting and other forensic technologies involved in criminal investigation.

events.name: Cellution
events.description: Round 1: a quiz about the topics involved in the problem statement. Round 2: The team must propose a viable solution for a developmental challenge in biotechnology.

events.name: Metallusion(Display)
events.description: A display of illusionary materials where participants can explore and interact with various unique materials.

events.name: Meta Forge
events.description: A quiz event where questions are based on guessing or a fun topic chosen by the participants.

events.name: Metarush
events.description: Participants solve clues related to metallurgy and materials. They will collect clues from each department.

events.name: Mysteries of Materials(demo)
events.description: Discover hidden mysteries behind iconic failures and achievements through interactive displays.

events.name: Mystery Maze
events.description: A classroom will be required and it will be completely dark, then participants will be given clues to find the materials among all materials which are hidden.

events.name: Inno Chem
events.description: The event offers a platform for inquisitive minds to present insights on Sustainable Energy and Environment: Role of Chemical Engineering, captivating the audience with flair and passion.

events.name: Chem Quest Auction
events.description: Teams bid on industrial chemical compounds to create meaningful reactions. The team with the most valid reactions wins.
rules: Teams start with a fixed number of points.
Bid on compounds in an auction format.
Bartering between teams is allowed after the auction.
The team with the most complete reactions wins.

events.name: Chem Relay Race
events.description: Teams compete in a relay race where each member must complete chemical-related challenges at various checkpoints across campus.

events.name: MATLAB Workshop
events.description: Participants will gain hands-on experience with MATLAB for applications in chemical engineering, including data analysis and simulation.

events.name: Chem E Case
events.description: Participants will analyze a problem statement in chemical engineering and present original solutions.

events.name: Find X
events.description: A multi-level mathematics-based competition where the competitors have to solve the mathematical challenges and gain that X points which will help them to win the competition.

events.name: Treco Hunt
events.description: Treasure hunt integrated with mathematics. Teams must solve mathematical puzzles and challenges to find clues.

events.name: Centre of Mass Game
events.description: Balance an object at their centre of mass using minimal support.

events.name: Science Quiz Relay
events.description: A quiz-based relay race where teams have to solve science problems quickly.

events.name: Optics Laser Target Game
events.description: Participants use mirrors and lenses to direct a laser beam at specific targets from a distance.

events.name: Physics Model Demonstration
events.description: Models which are based on the physical phenomenon.

events.name: Product Launch
events.description: The event aims at understanding the creativity of the team while launching a product.

events.name: Future Manager
events.description: An individual will be tested on leadership and other skills related to management.

events.name: Let him Cook
events.description: There will be 3-5 boxes, 2 containing organic and metal compounds named chits. One containing solvents, one containing reagents and catalyst named chits.

events.name: Chemistry Reaction Exhibit
events.description: Letting the participants perform simple reactions using day to day products and letting them know the chemistry behind it.

events.name: Periodic Table Battleship
events.description: 3 stages of activities will be there based on purely periodic table (Participants must be aware of each and everything related to periodic table).

events.name: Chemophile-Racing
events.description: It’s a toy car racing but the fuel for this car is not a battery or a fuel. This car will go on the principle of some reaction which can move that car. Anyone (individual) can design the reaction and present that car for the race.
